author: Staff Reporter
text:
Releasing the party’s third list of seats, State Congress president Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) were the key factors for the Left-Congress alliance in Bengal.

Mr. Chowdhury accused Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee of “supporting” the RSS to gain a foothold in Bengal and said this was a clear hint of the future “understanding” between the Trinamool Congress (TMC) and the BJP. “The fact that the RSS Shakhas have grown in an unprecedented manner in Bengal during the TMC regime proves the ruling party’s implicit support for them,” said Mr. Chowdhury on Saturday.

Describing the alliance with the Left Front as an “ongoing process” he said negotiations on seat sharing may go on “till the last phase” of the polls.

Mr. Chowdhury released a list of nine seats on Saturday and declared that the Congress would leave the Howrah Madhya seat in Howrah district to the Janata Dal (United). “We will publish the final list of candidates on Tuesday,” he said. Earlier, the Congress released names of 85 seats.
title: Trinamool supporting RSS in West Bengal: Congress
